title: Random test port does not work together with google-cloud-functions extensions
body:
### Describe the bug

Random test port does not work together with `quarkus-google-cloud-functions` and `quarkus-funqy-google-cloud-functions` extensions

Running `mvn clean verify -Dquarkus.http.test-port=0` with app that is using google cloud functions extensions.

Similar to https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/23581 issue for amazon-lambda

Example of errors:
```
[ERROR] Errors:
[ERROR]   GreetingFunctionsCloudEventsTest.testHelloCloudEvent:15 » IllegalArgument Port must be greater than 0
[ERROR]   GreetingFunctionsPubSubTest.testHelloPubSubWorld:15 » IllegalArgument Port must be greater than 0
[ERROR]   GreetingFunctionsStorageTest.testHelloGCSWorld:15 » IllegalArgument Port must be greater than 0
[INFO]
[ERROR] Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 3, Skipped: 0
```

### Expected behavior

Running `mvn clean verify -Dquarkus.http.test-port=0` passes

### Actual behavior

Running `mvn clean verify -Dquarkus.http.test-port=0` fails

### How to Reproduce?

 - get an app with google cloud functions - e.g. https://code.quarkus.io/?extension-search=origin:platform%20quarkus-google-cloud-functions or https://code.quarkus.io/?extension-search=origin:platform%20quarkus-funqy-google-cloud-functions
 - run `mvn clean verify -Dquarkus.http.test-port=0`

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

macOS

### Output of `java -version`

Java 17

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.2.4.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
